title: Sunak’s Ascent Is a Breakthrough for Diversity, With Privilege
description: Rishi Sunak’s ascent to the prime minister’s office is a significant milestone for Britain’s Indian diaspora. But for many, his immense personal wealth has made him less relatable.
dc:creator: Megan Specia and Isabella Kwai
media:credit: Andrew Testa for The New York Times
media:description: Celebrating Diwali in northwest London on Monday. As many as 1.5 million people of Indian descent live in England and Wales, making them the largest ethnic group after white Britons.
